wikitext.*:
{{quote|From Evereven's lofty hills
where softly silver fountains fall
his wings him bore, a wandering light,
beyond the mighty Mountain Wall.|[[The Fellowship of the Ring]], [[Many Meetings]] - ''[[Eärendillinwë]]''}} The '''Mountain Wall''' was a term that appears just once, in [[Bilbo Baggins]]'s poem ''Eärendillinwë'' quoted above. The meaning is not completely certain, but it seems to describe the [[Pelóri]], the [[Mountains of Defence]] that ranged along the eastern borders of [[Valinor]]. [[Category:Aman]] [[Category:Mountain ranges]]
